CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The EQEs were higher for the PEBDTPD device in the 550-900 nm range , partly because the PEBDTPD polymer has a higher light absorption at long wavelengths ( Figure 1a ) , which is consistent with the higher J sc values in the PEBDTPD device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph you provided:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD polymer |

The first instance of "PEBDTPD" refers to the device, while the second instance refers to the polymer material used in the device.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid Material Name entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEBDTPD |

The only valid Material Name entity in the paragraph is "PEBDTPD", which refers to the polymer material used in the device. The second instance of "PEBDTPD" in the sentence does not refer to the material name, but rather to the device itself, and therefore has been removed from the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The EQEs were higher for the PEBDTPD device in the 550-900 nm range , partly because the PEBDTPD polymer has a higher light absorption at long wavelengths ( Figure 1a ) , which is consistent with the higher J sc values in the PEBDTPD device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the Property Name entities in the given paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| EQEs |
| PEBDTPD device |
| PEBDTPD polymer |
| light absorption |
| J sc values |

Note that "PEBDTPD" is an abbreviation and not a property name. It stands for "Poly(ethylene-co-butylene)-based thermoplastic polyurethane-urea elastomer".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| EQEs |
| light absorption |
| J sc values |

The following entities do not clearly refer to material properties and were removed:

* PEBDTPD device (this is a device made from a material, but the name of the device itself is not a material property)
* PEBDTPD polymer (this is a material, but the name of the material is not a property)

Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The EQEs were higher for the PEBDTPD device in the 550-900 nm range , partly because the PEBDTPD polymer has a higher light absorption at long wavelengths ( Figure 1a ) , which is consistent with the higher J sc values in the PEBDTPD device.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the Property Value entities in the given paragraph:

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |

| higher light absorption | Property value |

| higher J sc values | Property value |

Note that "PEBDTPD device" is not a Property Value entity, as it is a device name and not a property or value. Similarly, "Figure 1a" is not a Property Value entity, as it is a figure reference and not a property or value.

The following entities do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and were removed:

* PEBDTPD polymer (material name)

Note that "PEBDTPD device" is not a Property Value entity, as it is a device name and not a property or value. Similarly, "Figure 1a" is not a Property Value entity, as it is a figure reference and not a property or value.
